SEARCH
Package examblock.model

Class Unit

Object
Unit
All Implemented Interfaces:
ManageableListItem, StreamManager
public class Unit extends Object implements StreamManager, ManageableListItem
An object describing a single-semester Year 12 Unit of a Year 12 Subject. These are typically Unit 3 or Unit 4 for the Year 12 units, but may be different.

  • Constructor Details

    • Unit

      public Unit(Subject subject, Character unitId, String title, String description, Registry registry)
      Constructs a new Subject Unit object. Consists of a parent Subject, the applicable unitId (typically '3' or '4' for Year 12), as a single character (i.e. '0' to '9' or 'A' to 'Z'); a unit title that may be multiple (optionally capitalised) words, including numbers (in words or digits) and/or Roman numerals (I,IV, etc.), each separated by a SINGLE space, with NO leading or trailing spaces and no trailing full stop (.), but other internal punctuation may be present - (titles supplied with multiple spaces or leading or trailing spaces must be rectified); AND a description, in whole English sentences, each beginning with a capital letter and finishing with a full stop.
      Parameters:
      subject - the parent subject of this unit.
      unitId - the single character unit identifier of this unit.
      title - the string title of this unit, consisting of one or more capitalised words separated by one or more spaces or other punctuation.
      description - the string description of this unit, in whole sentences, each beginning with a capital and finishing with a full stop, with words separated by one or more spaces or other punctuation.
      registry - the global object registry

    • Unit

      public Unit(BufferedReader br, Registry registry, int nthItem) throws IOException, RuntimeException
      Constructs a Unit by reading a description from a text stream
      Parameters:
      br - BufferedReader opened and ready to read from
      registry - the global object registry, needed to resolve textual Subject names
      nthItem - the index number of this serialized object
      Throws:
      IOException - on any read failure
      RuntimeException

  • Method Details

    • streamOut

      public void streamOut(BufferedWriter bw, int nthItem) throws IOException
      Used to write data to the disk.

      The format of the text written to the stream must be matched exactly by streamIn, so it is very important to format the output as described.

      3. ANCIENT HISTORY
      Ancient History, Unit 3: Reconstructing the Ancient World
      "Investigate significant historical periods through an analysis of relevant archaeological and written sources."
      Specified by:
      streamOut in interface StreamManager
      Parameters:
      bw - writer, already opened. Your data should be written at the current file position
      nthItem - a number representing this item's position in the stream. Used for sanity checks
      Throws:
      IOException - on any stream related issues

    • streamIn

      public void streamIn(BufferedReader br, Registry registry, int nthItem) throws IOException, RuntimeException
      Used to read data from the disk. IOExceptions and RuntimeExceptions must be allowed to propagate out to the calling method, which co-ordinates the streaming. Any other exceptions should be converted to RuntimeExceptions and rethrown.

      For the format of the text in the input stream, refer to the streamOut documentation.
      Specified by:
      streamIn in interface StreamManager
      Parameters:
      br - reader, already opened.
      registry - the global object registry
      nthItem - a number representing this item's position in the stream. Used for sanity checks
      Throws:
      IOException - on any stream related issues
      RuntimeException - on any logic related issues
